ui

Interface UI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Connect4Gui, Connect4TextConsole

    public interface UI
    The ui interface for the Connect4 game
    Version:
    2/1/20
    Author:
    Ryan Cluff, rpcluff, rpcluff@asu.edu

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayBoard(int[][] board)
      Prints a representation of the board using pipe and space characters as well as the two icons specified by the game itself
      void displayStatus(java.lang.String status)
      Sets the status text for the UI
      boolean getComputer()
      Prints a welcome message to the users and prompts whether the game will be 1 player or 2 player
      void setGameOver(boolean isGameOver)
      Indicates that the game has either been won or the board is full
      void setTurn(boolean turn) 

    • Method Detail

      • displayBoard

        void displayBoard(int[][] board)
        Prints a representation of the board using pipe and space characters as well as the two icons specified by the game itself
        Parameters:
        board - a 2D array representing the board
        icon1 - a string to be used to represent player 1's pieces
        icon2 - a string to be used to represent player 2's pieces

      • displayStatus

        void displayStatus(java.lang.String status)
        Sets the status text for the UI
        Parameters:
        status - text to be displayed

      • getComputer

        boolean getComputer()
        Prints a welcome message to the users and prompts whether the game will be 1 player or 2 player
        Returns:
        true if the player wants to play against a computer, false if against another player

      • setGameOver

        void setGameOver(boolean isGameOver)
        Indicates that the game has either been won or the board is full
        Parameters:
        isGameOver - true if game is over, false if not

      • setTurn

        void setTurn(boolean turn)
